value.title: Do you need a date table for time intelligence in Power BI? Nope! (Quick Measures)

Patrick shows you how you can use quick measures, like year over year, with a quick measure and no date table! value.title: Help your Power BI report users with an Information Panel
value.excerpt: Do your Power BI users understand your report? Chances are, at least not all of it. Adam walks you through how to do it in Power BI Desktop!  📢 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership

value.title: Power BI Reports and Buttons (new with Power BI Desktop - April 2018)
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick looks at Power BI reports and buttons. Buttons were added to Power BI Desktop in the April 2018 release. value.title: Power BI Tutorial: Dynamically Filter By Today's Date

value.title: Make Power BI Awesome with Python
value.excerpt: Using Python with Power BI is a dream made in Heaven. Learn how to incorporate machine learning models into Python that will amaze your boss and solve real world problems

topItems.title: Machine Learning in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: We can utilize Python and Scikit-Learn machine algorithms in Power with the Run Script option. In this example we will do churn analysis using an classification with the Logistic Regression package from Scikit_learn.  Check me out on LinkedIn   https://www.linkedin.com/in/gaelimholland

value.title: The Power BI Smart Narrative visual is INSANE AMAZING!
value.excerpt: The smart narrative visual can help tell the story in your Power BI report. Justyna Lucznik joins us to explore the visual and to illustrate how you can generate text about your data.  Make sure you have the September 2020 version of Power BI Desktop, or later.  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/visuals/power-bi-visualization-smart-narrative
